commit_message:
docs - Prevent eventlet exception during docs generation

build_sphinx has a lot of spurious tracebacks, We don't
really need this check for document generation

commit_message:
Change Scheduler access to Aggregates

So as to fork the Scheduler code into a separate project, we need to
change the way the Scheduler accesses other Nova objects
This change is only focusing on aggregates.
Regarding accesses to aggregates table, the change can be divided in
two parts:
- Modify ResourceTracker update_available_resource so that it provides
  scheduler aggregates info the host belongs to, as a JSON in stats.
- Call update_available_resource im add/remove_aggregate_host() to update
  the host state if host is added or removed from an aggregate.

Note: no other data except JSON will be changed in compute_nodes.
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8ef3397afd7470c9948b056445053692c178446e
Implements: blueprint isolate-scheduler-db

The openrc file that is downloaded from Horizon is missing the
OS_REGION_NAME setting. This causes issues in environments that have
multiple regions. If the Region is none, ensure that it is unset after

commit_message:
Add OS_REGION_NAME to openrc

The openrc file that is downloaded from Horizon is missing the
OS_REGION_NAME setting. This causes issues in environments that have
multiple regions. If the Region is none, ensure that it is unset after
sourcing the rc file to avoid and empty variable. This fix also cleans
up some language in the generated openrc file.

Change-Id: Ieab0b13afd79158c6bf603891164f01aff3aabf3
Closes-Bug: #1334791

extra colon (:) to remove ERROR(s) and WARNING(s)

TestSubresourcePlugin class in test_api_v2.py so that it
meets pep8 requirements and matches up with the rest of the code.

commit_message:
Add standard constants for CPU architectures

Introduce a nova/compute/arch.py module to serve a similar role
to nova/compute/vmmode.py, by providing constants for known
CPU architectures and validation/canonicalization APIs

Related-bug: #1348624
Change-Id: Idd4907b5488dd0832c15783d87d57d77ae654519
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/89/109589/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os import mock from nova.compute import arch from nova import exception from nova import test class ArchTest(test.NoDBTestCase): @mock.patch.object(os, "uname") def test_host(self, mock_uname): os.uname.return_value = ( 'Linux', 'localhost.localdomain', '3.14.8-200.fc20.x86_64', '#1 SMP Mon Jun 16 21:57:53 UTC 2014', 'i686' ) self.assertEqual(arch.I686, arch.from_host()) def test_valid_string(self): self.assertTrue(arch.is_valid("x86_64")) def test_valid_constant(self): self.assertTrue(arch.is_valid(arch.X86_64)) def test_valid_bogus(self): self.assertFalse(arch.is_valid("x86_64wibble")) def test_canonicalize_i386(self): self.assertEqual(arch.I686, arch.canonicalize("i386")) def test_canonicalize_case(self): self.assertEqual(arch.X86_64, arch.canonicalize("X86_64")) def test_canonicalize_bogus(self): self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidArchitectureName, arch.canonicalize, "x86_64wibble")

commit_message:
Fix test for stack delete on same active engine

The test was not starting the EngineListener, thus the engine_id was
None, so the corresponding code execution path was not actually
exercised.

Change-Id: If48ba9d3deb54f8e9ea1ed1987f832ddbaed33fc

added_lines: self.man.start() # this is to simulate lock release on DummyThreadGroup stop self.m.StubOutWithMock(stack_lock.StackLock, 'acquire') stack_lock.StackLock.acquire().AndReturn(None) with mock.patch.object(self.man.thread_group_mgr, 'stop', side_effect=self.man.thread_group_mgr.stop ) as stop_mock: self.assertIsNone(self.man.delete_stack(self.ctx, stack.identifier())) self.assertEqual(1, stop_mock.call_count) self.assertEqual((stack.id,), stop_mock.call_args[0])

commit_message:
Add required_contexts validator

Add a validator that checks if a benchmark scenario has defined in its
configuration file the context(s) that it requires to run first.

Example:
@validation.required_contexts("context1", "context2")
def benchmark_scenario():
  pass

Change-Id: Id83a6ff93acde2abbb29ec8351210e38d725ce48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/03/111603/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def required_contexts(*args): def _required_contexts(func): def wrapper(self, **kwargs): for context in args: if not self.context().get("config").get(context): message = (_("Context '%s' is required but is missing from" " the benchmark configuration file") % context) return ValidationResult(False, message) # The above seems to "work" in the sense that it actually # checks if the required context(s) of the scenario can # be found in its configuration file. However, after # using the validator() or add(validator) functions # errors are produced. Also the statement that returns # the ValidationResult object produces an error without # one of them. Uploaded for any comments. return wrapper return _required_contexts

commit_message:
Allow ResourceGroup to select an attribute path

Starting with the Juno version of HOT, ResourceGroup will take the path
into account when returning a list of attributes from get_attr. So
something like:

  {get_attr: [my_rsrc_group, networks, <network_name>, 0]}

will return a list of the first IP address of each server in the resource
group.

Closes-Bug: #1341048
Change-Id: I774dd14cd2e9ff878a214d5ea81faa6070bc48bf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/42/106542/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if key == self.REFS: path = [] else: path = [key] + list(path) return [get_rsrc_attr(str(n), *path) for n in range(count)]
deleted_lines: attr = [] if key == self.REFS else [key] attribute = [get_rsrc_attr(str(n), *attr) for n in range(count)] return attributes.select_from_attribute(attribute, path)

commit_message:
VMware: Resize operation fails to change disk size

The finish_migration step will resize the cpu and memory to match
the new flavor chosen, but not the disk size. Additional code was
added to extend the disk size using ExtendVirtualDisk_Task.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iff10443f603d329d01a74a620079f80518b75a50
Closes-bug: #1291741

commit_message:
Don't use Django 1.4.0 nor 1.4.1

Versions 1.4.0 and 1.4.1 don't have the function `force_text` which
replaces `force_unicode`, Django>=1.4.2 running in Python3 doesn't
expose `force_unicode`.

Change-Id: If15427d0cba3fd762beefaa0e956edfda003774a

commit_message:
Fix l3.filters and dhcp.filters file for tripleo installations

This change addresses a rootwrap filter issue specific to the l3-agent
and dhcp-agent in a tripleo deployment.  The location of the python
executable used in starting processes within a tripleo deployment
may be different than the /usr/bin/python location that is used
for the KillFilter in l3.filters and dhcp.filters.

Closes-Bug: #1272816

Change-Id: I4c78b074e298f49eae559c7ca451fa7f9fec5970
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/87/97887/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # tripleo specific neutron-rootwrap command filter for nodes on which neutron is # expected to control network # This filter addresses issue with l3-agent running in tripleo where the path # to python is different. # # This file should be owned by (and only-writeable by) the root user # format seems to be # cmd-name: filter-name, raw-command, user, args [Filters] kill_metadata_tripleo: KillFilter, root, /opt/stack/venvs/neutron/bin/python, -9 kill_metadata7_tripleo: KillFilter, root, /opt/stack/venvs/neutron/bin/python2.7, -9 kill_metadata6_tripleo: KillFilter, root, /opt/stack/venvs/neutron/bin/python2.6, -9

commit_message:
Add initial service provider API for OS-FEDERATION

Add an initial draft for service providers.
Related spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100023/

Change-Id: Ie0ab7e421b46f354a62be9bb6173518ed47627a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack-attic/identity-api refs/changes/23/103223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ### Service Providers: ``/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers`` A service provider is a service that is trusted by an identity service to not abuse the privacy of the identity attributes that are given to it. Optional attributes: * ``description`` (string) Describes the service provider. If a value is not specified by the client, the service may default this value to either an empty string or ``null``. * ``enabled`` (boolean) Indicates whether the Identity Service should assert federation identities to this service provider. If a value is not specified by the client, the service may default this to either `true` or `false`. Service Provider API -------------------- ### Register a service provider: ``PUT /OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/{sp_id}`` Request: { "service_provider": { "description": "CSP1 service provider", "enabled": true } } Response: Status: 201 Created { "service_provider": { "description": "CSP1 service provider", "enabled": true, "id": "BETA-CSP", "links": { "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/BETA-CSP" } } } ### List service providers: ``GET /OS-FEDERATION/service_providers`` Response: Status: 200 OK { "service_providers": [ { "description": "CSP1 service provider", "enabled": true, "id": "BETA-CSP", "links": { "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/BETA-CSP" } }, { "description": "GAMMA service provider", "enabled": false, "id": "GAMMA-CSP", "links": { "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/GAMMA-CSP" } } ], "links": { "next": null, "previous": null, "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers" } } ### Get service provider: ``GET /OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/{sp_id}`` Response: Status: 200 OK { "service_provider": { "description": "CSP1 service provider", "enabled": true, "id": "BETA-CSP", "links": { "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/BETA-CSP" } } } ### Delete service provider: ``DELETE /OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/{sp_id}`` When a service provider is deleted, the list of active assertions are available to the service providers so that adequate token revocation can be performed. Response: Status: 204 No Content ### Update a service provider: ``PATCH /OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/{sp_id}`` Request: { "service_provider": { "enabled": true } } Response: Status: 200 OK { "service_provider": { "description": "CSP1 service provider", "enabled": true, "id": "BETA-CSP", "links": { "self": "http://identity:35357/v3/OS-FEDERATION/service_providers/BETA-CSP" } } } When a service provider is disabled, the list of active assertions are available to the service providers so that adequate token revocation can be performed.

commit_message:
Add include_locations kwarg to nova.image.API.get()

To avoid feature envy from image backends that need image location URIs,
functionality of nova.image.glance._get_locations() is moved into
nova.image.glance.show() and exposed via a new include_locations kwarg
to the nova.image.API.get() method, which, when True, simply includes a
collection of location links when the image has them.

blueprint rbd-clone-image-handler
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I5118013aa24f68520dee806c24265f2808a90588

commit_message:
Remove direct calls to dbapi's get_node_by_instance

Small patch to patch remove the direct calls to dbapi's
get_node_by_instance. It's replaced by Node.get_by_instance_uuid().

Partial-Bug: #1314732
Change-Id: Idfcab25edbc950ce8093b4e0987be5a885828530

subject: Refactor serializer import to XmlBodyMiddleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-31 22:53:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/cba406403e6b7150f1d4305b68173b9a79058f23', 'message': 'Making import lxml optional

We try to import lxml if we cannot we inform the user.
Try to import serializer and if we cannot log error.

Change-Id: I977275d0df8666b49ddbfadd4f5606d7c2292b1f
CLoses-Bug: 1351016
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-01 16:05:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/a2fb5bcb2ffc7a2b2be4015038f37831b115a32e', 'message': "Check if lxml is installed before import

Previously, the keystone/middleware/core.py would import
keystone/common/serializer.py regardless of the XmlBodyMiddleware class
being used. This change uses the try_import method of oslo's
importutils.py module to move the import inside the __init__ of the
XmlBodyMiddleware class since that is the only place that it is used.

Change-Id: I977275d0df8666b49ddbfadd4f5606d7c2292b1f
CLoses-Bug: 1351016
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-01 16:11:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/ef22027f993ba94373e28012615bfac1a6630bb0', 'message': "Check if lxml is installed before import

Previously, the keystone/middleware/core.py module would import
keystone/common/serializer.py regardless of the XmlBodyMiddleware class

Change-Id: I977275d0df8666b49ddbfadd4f5606d7c2292b1f
CLoses-Bug: 1351016
'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2014-08-04 19:38:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/3e53f25ad6caec123e0a1cbfe94688fd3eb66d03', 'message': 'Refactor serializer import to XmlBodyMiddleware

Previously, the keystone/middleware/core.py module would import
keystone/common/serializer.py regardless of the XmlBodyMiddleware class
being used. This change modifies keystone/common/serializer.py to raise
an error if there is an issue with using lxml at runtime.

commit_message:
Refactor serializer import to XmlBodyMiddleware

Previously, the keystone/middleware/core.py module would import
keystone/common/serializer.py regardless of the XmlBodyMiddleware class
being used. This change modifies keystone/common/serializer.py to raise
an error if there is an issue with using lxml at runtime.

Change-Id: I977275d0df8666b49ddbfadd4f5606d7c2292b1f
Closes-Bug: 1351016
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/08/111108/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystone.openstack.common import importutils if importutils.try_import('lxml') is None: raise ImportError('Could not load lxml') self.serializer = importutils.try_import('keystone.common.serializer') if self.serializer is None: LOG.error('Could not import keystone.common.serializer') self.serializer.from_xml(request.body)) response.body = self.serializer.to_xml(body_obj, xmlns=self.xmlns)
deleted_lines: from keystone.common import serializer serializer.from_xml(request.body)) response.body = serializer.to_xml(body_obj, xmlns=self.xmlns)

commit_message:
Check for flavor creation added

What is done:
* default value for `flavor` variable returned by _create_flavor added
* checking for flavor for all dependent on it tests added
* change tested by manual syncing of code on master node

Change-Id: If8e2cba738169b1c19c37a2a7c545426ae7c9f16
Closes-Bug: #1349924

commit_message:
Adds neutron scripts for training labs

Adds neutron scripts for training labs which will install and configure
neutron.

Change-Id: Ie4cb9df2c3c3e1928841a64bf4a793d3b75bf334
Partial-Bug: 1312764
Implements: blueprint openstack-training-labs
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/22/113122/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env bash TOP_DIR=$(cd $(dirname "$0")/.. && pwd) source "$TOP_DIR/config/paths" source "$CONFIG_DIR/credentials" source "$LIB_DIR/functions.guest" source "$CONFIG_DIR/labs-openstackrc.sh" exec_logfile indicate_current_auto #------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Set up Networking Service (neutron) for controller node. #------------------------------------------------------------------------------ echo "Installing neutron for controller node." sudo apt-get install -y neutron-server echo "Setting up database for neutron." setup_database neutron function get_database_url { local db_user=$(service_to_db_user neutron) local db_password=$(service_to_db_password neutron) local database_host=controller-mgmt echo "mysql://$db_user:$db_password@$database_host/neutron" } database_url=$(get_database_url) echo "Configuring neutron for controller node." echo "Setting database connection: $database_url." iniset_sudo /etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini database connection "$database_url" iniset_sudo /etc/neutron/neutron.conf database connection "$database_url" neutron_admin_user=$(service_to_user_name neutron) neutron_admin_password=$(service_to_user_password neutron) echo "Creating neutron user and giving it admin role under service tenant." keystone user-create \ --name "$neutron_admin_user" \ --pass "$neutron_admin_password" \ --email neutron@domain.com keystone user-role-add \ --user "$neutron_admin_user" \ --tenant "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME" \ --role "$ADMIN_ROLE_NAME" echo "Configuring neutron to use keystone for authentication." echo "Configuring neutron ovs plugin.ini" conf=/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini iniset_sudo $conf ovs tenant_network_type gre iniset_sudo $conf ovs tunnel_id_ranges 1:1000 iniset_sudo $conf ovs enable_tunneling True iniset_sudo $conf agent tunnel_types gre iniset_sudo $conf securitygroup firewall_driver neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriver echo "Configure neutron api-paste.ini" conf=/etc/neutron/api-paste.ini iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken firewall_driver neutron.agent.linux.iptables_firewall.OVSHybridIptablesFirewallDriverpaste. iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken filter_factory keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken auth_host controller-mgmt iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken auth_port 35357 iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken auth_protocol http iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken admin_tenant_name "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME" iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken admin_user "$neutron_admin_user" iniset_sudo $conf filter:authtoken admin_password "$neutron_admin_password" echo "Configure neutron.conf" conf=/etc/neutron/neutron.conf iniset_sudo $conf default rabbit_host controller-mgmt iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken auth_host controller-mgmt iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken auth_port 35357 iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken auth_protocol http iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken admin_tenant_name "$SERVICE_TENANT_NAME" iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken admin_user "$neutron_admin_user" iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken admin_password "$neutron_admin_password" iniset_sudo $conf keystone_authtoken signing_dir /var/lib/neutron/keystone-signing echo "Registering neutron with keystone so that other services can locate it." keystone service-create \ --name neutron \ --type image \ --description "OpenStack Image Service" neutron_service_id=$(keystone service-list | awk '/ image / {print $2}') keystone endpoint-create \ --service-id "$neutron_service_id" \ --publicurl "http://controller-api:9696" \ --adminurl "http://controller-mgmt:9696" \ --internalurl "http://controller-mgmt:9696" echo "Restarting neutron service." sudo service neutron-server restart

commit_message:
lost pycrypto requirement leads to ImportError

When porting oslo.config.generator to automatically generate trove
conf files, an ImportError happens
when trove.openstack.common.rpc.securemessage is imported as module.

Change-Id: I6ce715f3b8976812f391cdf5a7bc7616535489a6
Closes-Bug: #1353799
Related-Bug: #1234338
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/17/112517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pycrypto>=2.6.1
